explatoms.game¶

Classes

FieldType(value)

A field type enumeration.

Game([field_type])

A game that contains a field of squares.
class explatoms.game.FieldType(value)¶

A field type enumeration.

BIG = 2¶

The big field.

HUGE = 3¶

The huge field.

MEDIUM = 1¶

The medium field.

SMALL = 0¶

The small field.

get_size() → int¶

Retrieve the size of self.

Returns

The size of self.

Return type

int

This is meant to be the length of a side of a square field.

class explatoms.game.Game(field_type: explatoms.game.FieldType = FieldType.MEDIUM)¶

A game that contains a field of squares.

Parameters

field_type (FieldType) – The field type, defaults to FieldType.MEDIUM.

Variables

  • __field_type (FieldType) – The field type used in self.

  • __current_player (Player) – The player whose move it is now.

  • __field (list[list[Square]]) – The field that is made out of squares.

GObject Signals

Name

Parameters

Description

is-over

winner (Player) – The winner.

Is emitted when the game ends.

square-change

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the square.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the square.

  • atom_number (int) – The number of atoms on the square.

  • owner (Player) – The owner of atoms on the square.

Is emitted when a square changes.

current-player-change

current_player (Player) – The current player.

Is emitted when the current player changes.
__create_field() → None¶

Fill the field with squares.

Return type

None

__determine_square_type(x: int, y: int) → explatoms.square.SquareType¶

Retrieve the type of a square according to its coordinates in the field.

Parameters

  • x (int) – The x coordinate.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate.

Returns

The square type.

Return type

SquareType

__emit_square_changes(changed_squares: Iterable) → None¶

Notify listeners of changed squares.

Parameters

changed_squares (Iterable) – Squares that have changed.

Return type

None

__explode_atoms(x: int, y: int) → bool¶

Explode atoms from the square with given coordinates.

Parameters

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the square.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the square.

Returns

True if this has resulted in an infinite loop of explosions, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

This explodes atoms until there is no full squares.

This results in an infinite loop of explosions only if atoms of all squares have exploded.

__set_current_player(player: explatoms.player.Player) → None¶

Set the current player and notifies listeners of this change.

Parameters

player (Player) – The current player.

Return type

None

get_field_type() → explatoms.game.FieldType¶

Retrieve the type of the field used in self.

Returns

The field type used in self.

Return type

FieldType

place_atom(x: int, y: int) → bool¶

Place an atom on the square with given coordinates on behalf of the current player.

Parameters

  • x (int) – The x coordinate of the square.

  • y (int) – The y coordinate of the sqaure.

Returns

True if the atom has been placed, False otherwise.

Return type

bool

An atom cannot be placed on a square with opponent’s atoms.

This causes square_change signals to be emitted. If there are no available further moves, emits is_over signal.
